title: Spack stuck installing libxml2 (curl does not download xmlts)
body:
Hi, 
I am trying to use spack and to show it to my local research group as an alternative for package management. When doing spack install lmod , if gets stuck when it is downloading libxml2 and its resources.  In particular, it tries to download xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz, reaches 99.9% , stops there for a while, and then throws an error about an error downloading the package.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install libxml2
```

### Error Message

==> Installing libxml2
==> Searching for binary cache of libxml2
==> Finding buildcaches in /mirror/build_cache
==> No binary for libxml2 found: installing from source
==> Fetching file:///mirror/libxml2/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /mirror/libxml2/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///mirror/libxml2/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz failed.
==> Fetching http://xmlsoft.org/sources/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Fetching file:///mirror/libxml2/xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /mirror/libxml2/xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///mirror/libxml2/xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz failed.
==> Fetching http://www.w3.org/XML/Test/xmlts20080827.tar.gz
#######################################################################   99.9% # IT STAYS HERE FOR A MINUTE AND THEN IT GIVES THE FOLLOWING
curl: (18) transfer closed with 430 bytes remaining to read
==> Fetching from http://www.w3.org/XML/Test/xmlts20080827.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for resource-xmlts-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk

/root/repos/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1064, in do_fetch:
       1061                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
       1062                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
       1063
  >>   1064        self.stage.create()
       1065        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1066        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1067

If I try curl on that file, it works
root@darkstar:~/repos/spack# curl https://www.w3.org/XML/Test/xmlts20080827.tar.gz -o xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  623k  100  623k    0     0   333k      0  0:00:01  0:00:01 --:--:--  333k
Or with wget it also downloads. If I put the curl or wget downloaded file in the mirror directory everything works:
==> Fetching file:///mirror/libxml2/xmlts-2.9.9.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /tmp/root/spack-stage/libxml2-2.9.9-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk/libxml2-2.9.9.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /tmp/root/spack-stage/libxml2-2.9.9-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk
==> Staging archive: /tmp/root/spack-stage/resource-xmlts-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk/xmlts20080827.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /tmp/root/spack-stage/resource-xmlts-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk
==> Moving resource stage
        source : /tmp/root/spack-stage/resource-xmlts-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk/spack-src/
        destination : /tmp/root/spack-stage/libxml2-2.9.9-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk/spack-src/xmlconf
==> No patches needed for libxml2
==> Building libxml2 [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Successfully installed libxml2
  Fetch: 2.62s.  Build: 29.04s.  Total: 31.66s.
[+] /root/repos/spack/opt/spack/linux-slackware14-nehalem/gcc-5.5.0/libxml2-2.9.9-ltda6wduib2vz72whtguvzh4qiul5xxk

So there is something related with spack and its curl invocation.

PS: I am behind a proxy and I tested all this under the same environment using both http_proxy and https_proxy vars, and setting the proxy inside ~/.curlrc .  

I am running slackware 14.2 64 bits.

Thanks in advance for any guidance
